title: 115_s440
content: In this Act, key definitions include the Department referring to Dickinson Parks & Recreation, Dickinson Reservoir as part of the Dickinson Unit, Game and Fish Headquarters, and the Management Agreement for land development and operation. The Act defines key terms related to the management and operation of lands and recreation facilities at Dickinson Reservoir, including terms like Map, Permitted cabin land, Property, Recreation land, Secretary, and State. The State of North Dakota, through the North Dakota Game and Fish Department, will convey recreation land and permitted cabin land to the Dickinson Department of Parks and Recreation within 5 years at no cost, subject to management requirements and easements. The Department of Parks and Recreation will receive recreation land from the North Dakota Game and Fish Department at no cost. The Department will pay for all survey and administrative costs for title transfers. The recreation land will be managed for public access, fish and wildlife habitat, and to preserve its natural character. The Department will manage permitted cabin land for existing cabins or recreational residences and for recreation land management purposes. Haying and grazing may continue on recreation land used for those purposes. The Department will manage permitted cabin land for existing cabins or recreational residences and for recreation land management purposes. If a parcel of land conveyed under subsection (a)(1)(A) or (B) is used inconsistently with the requirements, it may revert to the United States. If the Department sells permitted cabin land, it will be at fair market value, excluding improvements made by the permit holder. The Department will manage permitted cabin land for existing cabins or recreational residences and for recreation land management purposes. If a parcel of land conveyed under subsection (a)(1)(A) or (B) is used inconsistently with the requirements, it may revert to the United States. If the Department sells permitted cabin land, it will be at fair market value, excluding improvements made by the permit holder. The permit holder shall not be included in the appraised value of the land. Proceeds from the sale of land by the Department that exceed the costs of preparing the sale shall be paid to the Secretary. Any amounts paid to the Secretary for land conveyed under this Act shall be made available for activities relating to the operation of the Dickinson Dam and Reservoir. The Secretary shall convey all right, title, and interest of the United States in the Game and Fish Headquarters to the State within 5 years of the enactment of this Act. The United States will convey the game and fish headquarters to the State with the condition that it continues to be used for similar purposes. If the land is used inconsistently, it may revert back to the United States. Conveyances made under this Act are subject to existing rights and operational requirements of the Pick-Sloan Missouri River Basin Program. The conveyance of property includes reservations such as flowage easements, mineral rights, permits, and deed restrictions. Applicable easements for vehicular access are also granted. The United States is not liable for flood damage to a property subject to a permit, the Department, or the State, except for damages caused by the United States or its employees. Temporary flooding or flood damage is not considered a taking by the United States. During the interim period after the enactment of this Act, the Management Agreement provisions, leases, and permits related to the property or land shall remain in effect until conveyance. The curr_chunk can be summarized as: "Speaker of the House of Representatives and Vice President of the United States."
